headline: Lime Chicken Soft Tacos
description: These chicken tacos with a flavorful lime and oregano chicken filling are super easy to make. Top with cheese and salsa for a family-pleasing meal.

video.description: Check out these lime flavored chicken soft tacos.
video.name: Lime Chicken Soft Tacos

name: Lime Chicken Soft Tacos
recipeIngredient: 1.5 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast meat - cubed

recipeInstructions.text: Sauté chicken in a medium saucepan over medium high heat until tender, about 15 to 20 minutes. Add green onions, vinegar, lime juice, garlic, oregano, sugar, salt, and pepper. Simmer over low heat for 10 minutes.

Heat an iron skillet over medium heat. Place a tortilla in the pan, warm, and turn over to heat the other side. Repeat with remaining tortillas. Serve lime chicken mixture in warm tortillas topped with tomato, lettuce, cheese and salsa.

review.reviewBody: So delicious!! Just added a bit more lime juice.
Good recipe. Next time I will double the sauce.
The kids loved it. Easy to make. Thanks for the recipe.
Delicious. Doubled the sauce. Also used shrimp (with adjusted cooking time) with this recipe and it was also very good. Everyone had good things to say about the meal.
Great recipe as is-I added cumin and tequila :-)
This was really good. I'll be making this again tomorrow. Very messy though... Don't wear a nice shirt....
Followed recipe exactly, except added some black beans just because I had them…great, quick dinner. Next time might try fish. This is a keeper.

This recipe was outstanding. Very good job coming up with this one. Not your typical chicken tacos. Also I just wanna say, its one of my favorite things in the world to see reviews where people completely change the recipe and then give only 3 or less stars.
I enjoyed it and the kids enjoyed it. I used fresh cilantro instead of oregano. It did not take as long to cook as the recipe says, which I expected. I will make it again.
Sooo good! I like to make it vegetarian by subbing peppers, onions and beans for the chicken.
AWESOME recipe. I added cilantro and served on "street tacos" tortillas. This will be a staple in our house. VERY, VERY GOOD!
This is a very versatile recipe. The chicken is very good in tacos, but also in quesadillas, wraps and with rice. I have been using this recipe for several years and love it.
Excellent recipe. I used 2 limes as we love anything lime. Made it have so much flavor. I also sprinkled lemon pepper seasoning on chicken prior to cooking. Hubby loved it as well.

I made this but remixed it. The red wine vinegar didn’t sit right with my spirit. I used champagne citrus vinegar. Tripled the sauce, used 2/3 as a marinade, added the final 1/3 to the pan at the end with a splash of Mezcal. No oregano. Also didn’t fit right with my spirit. Used cilantro. Added cumin, chipotle chili powder, smoked paprika. 3 stars for the recipe as a starting point. 5 stars for me for my remix on this recipe.
It was off the chain delicious and bursting with unexpected flavor
I added spanish rice and refried beans to my tacos
Very light and refreshing. We squeezed the fresh lime over the tacos before serving, and it was a big hit.

Really good flavor for taco night. The smell of it cooking is that Of an authentic Mexican restaurant we love here in Az (strange, another reviewer said the same!) While some recipes turn out strong, overpowering the meal this was a nice blend of compile flavors and more a hint of lime. Gave it four stars because we did add a dash of chipotle chili, which took it up a notch. All around keeper for taco night!
Added cumin and garlic powder to make it more authentic , cilantro before serving of course .

Like others here, I tripled the liquids and made a made a marinade, Using 2/3 for marinating the chicken for about 3 hours...reserving the remaining third for the cook. Also switched out oregano for cilantro. I cooked until the sauce became thick and coated the meat. This variation tastes Better imho, than the original which I tried earlier
Yummy! Easy for beginners too!
I subsituted the sugar to stevia (trying to cut down on sugar) it was perfect no after taste. Easy and quick.
Chicken turned out super moist!

This is a great Recipe. I only changed two things...1. I used fresh chopped cilantro instead of oregano. The oregano just didn’t appeal to me in a Mexican taco. And, 2. I used 4 cloves of garlic because we LOVE garlic in our food. The lime and vinegar give the chicken a nice tangy, fresh taste. I added some avocado to my fixings bar as well. My family devoured this so I will definitely be making it again!

These are awesome! I make these and usually double everything but the chicken and let the chicken marinade in the ingredients for about 30 minutes before cooking and just cook everything together. I also sometimes substitute regular chopped onion if that's all I have on hand. My family loves these tacos, and I get requests to make them every couple weeks.

This was an easy recipe and a refreshing change for dinner. I did make a couple changes to the recipe. I first boiled the small cubes of chicken then drained the water and saute the chicken with the remaining ingredients I increased the sauce with 2 limes and omitted oregano for cilantro. I didn't have red wine vinegar on hand so I used apple cider vinegar instead. I added a little extra garlic. I omitted the tomato and the salsa for dietary reasons. I used romaine lettuce finely sliced using mostly the greenest part of the lettuce. This was a delicious and nutritious meal. Thank you!

I used leftover chicken thighs, fresh oregano, and hard tacos, and I added a dollop of sour cream atop each taco, but otherwise followed the recipe. A great way to flavor the chicken for taco filling, and another alternative to make chicken leftovers tasty and appealing! Thanks for the recipe!
Great taste and easy to make!
Used cilantro instead of oregano and added jalepeno pepper! Yummy

Tasted best with flour tortillas. I used chicken thighs for a richer taste. Also, I don't like raw tomatoes, Cilantro, or peppers, so I cooked them with the meat. Definitely needs a good salsa to complete the meal. Cheese didn't seem to add much flavor.
I made this as directed and loved it! Always looking for something different to do with chicken. Tasted like something you'd find in a restaurant! Thank you for sharing!
I added cumin, and garnished with cilantro. I served it with coleslaw. Very yummy.

Enjoyed making this easy dish, taste was outstanding. Next time, I would add more lime juice immediately before serving. Left-overs made a great taco salad the next day. Will make again. Thanks for the recipe.
Made no changes, and it was a hit. I'm making it again tonight. It's very easy to repurpose leftovers (if there are any.)
This is SO delicious. I tripled it and cut down on the garlic, salt and pepper as a result of tripling. Loved the lime flavor.
Husband and kids loved it. Will definitely be adding this to my rotation.
I love the wine vinegar and lime combo. Great recipe!!
These turned out really good! I omitted the oregano, and I am glad I did! I think using the little boat tortillas would be good, shredding the chicken, adding sour cream and avocados!
These were really good! The kids ate them with Mexican rice in the tacos, as well.
Love Love Love

After reading all the reviews I followed others' suggestions to double the sauce, and tripled the lime juice. I substituted cilantro for the oregano, using both dried and fresh, added cumin, finely chopped onion, both red & jalapeno peppers as well as a generous "splash" of tequila to the marinade. After marinating the chicken, then sauteing and chopping it up (I sauteed it in thin slices first ) I added the marinade into the chicken and let it simmer together for about 10 minutes. I followed the suggestion from Cindi M for the Baja Cream (1/4 c. mayo, 1/4 c. sour cream, 1 Tbsp. fresh lime juice, + some finely grated lime peel & chill to meld the flavors). It was a great addition, along with finely sliced cabbage, instead of lettuce, chopped tomatoes, grated cheese & salsa. They were a HUGE hit at our house and will be a part of our regular rotation from here on out. Thank you Marissa Wright for the great recipe!
Very delicious. Adding lime to the chicken while it cooked made it amazing.
Doubled the recipe and tripled the sauce. Used cilantro instead of oregano. Outstanding result. All of my VERY picky kids loved it.

I followed numerous reviewers suggestions, including marinating the chicken ahead of time and cutting the chicken in strips. It was good but was not as flavorful as I expected. Will try again with a spicier salsa.
I squeezed extra lime juice into it, but this was fabulous! My whole family loved it!!
I shredded the chicken instead of cubing it. Pretty quick and easy recipe with good flavors. Great weekday dinner. Will be making this again.
This is one of my wife and I’s favorite recipes. The flavor is just enough and no one ingredient over powers. Great quick after work meal.

I made this tonight to the tee with the exception of switching out oregano for cilantro. I left it at the original setting stating it had ten servings but there was not enough chicken for a family of four.

Pretty good.I think next time I would add some water to create a bit of a sauce. The chicken was a little dry. Flavour was nice. I added a tiny bit of cilantro to make a little more mexican. I also had guacamole as an optional topping.
Super easy dinner, my husband really likes these tacos
I loved this! I did use cilantro instead of oregano and I added a little chili powder and cumin. I also shredded the chicken.

it was a great fast dish. All 5 of my kids and my husband loved it. That seals the deal for me! :) I didn't put oregano in it, I added some cumin instead. And I added cilantro to the tacos along with some avocado and lettuce. Great taste! :)

Very easy and very tasty. One had cheddar cheese and the other had goat cheese.
thank you for the recipe.

This was a great recipe! We loved the lime with the chicken. I made this recipe as written, but substituted cumin for the oregano. Next time I will increase the cumin to 2 tsp. The fact that it was easy to make in addition to being tasty is another reason to make it again. :-)

Insanely good! I didn't have red wine vinegar so I substituted with apple cider vinegar and added a little extra sugar. Also no oregano so I used fresh rosemary that I just happened to have. Topped with ranch, oh so good! Will make again.
Only change was I subed Stevia for the sugar and it turned out great.

I really enjoyed this recipe. I would never have put oregano and lime together but added with all the other ingredients it was really good. It was easy and fast too. An excellent meal for a weeknight! I also added cilantro in the tortilla, yum.
I make this . but i use apple cider vinegar because i didnt have the wine vinegar. My husband loved it and so did I. It was awesome.
Made this delicious recipe adding a bit of cumin and chopped culantro...yummy!
I liked the flavor of the chicken but it didn't "wow" me. It's just OK.

I made this. My husband and I loved it !
I used 1 1/4 lb chicken, cubed and all of the lime juice from 1 lime. Didn't have green onions, just used regular yellow.
Will be passing it along to my children.
Delicious addition to a Mexican themed dinner! Flavourful. Easy.

Like others, I substituted cumin for the oregano. I increased the lime juice and added some chili powder for more taste, as I found it a little bland. I sliced the chicken thinly and sautéed it, then added the juice and spices. I served it as a deconstructed taco in a bowl, with basmati rice with lime zest and parsley, (not a cilantro fan), black beans, cheese, olives, tomatoes and green onions on top, with guacamole on the side. This was a great meal and I’m making it again tonight!

I made this once as is and it was okay. That is why I give it 3 stars. 

The second time I doubled the sauce and that was definitely a must. I also used a normal onion rather than green onions and cilantro rather than oregano. 

My complaint is that it still didn't taste lime-y enough, so next time I will double the lime. I may also add a tiny amount of cumin as well.
This is a good recipe. I used "Just Grilled Chicken Strips" from Trader Joes which cut the prep time down even more.
Loved this. I made it as written.

Yum - did as other reviewers suggested - subbed in fresh cilantro for the oregano and used a whole lime. I cooked a whole chicken in the crockpot in advance and then shredded it. Used soft corn tortillas. Had leftover chicken so used in a Tex-Mex soup found on this site the next day. 
Great recipe - thanks!
I used leftover rotisserie chicken and heated it up with the other ingredients. The flavor is amazing!
It was good. We liked it

These tacos were so delicious and easy to make. I chopped up half of a white onion and added it to the chicken a few minutes before the other ingredients and also served them with lime wedges to squeeze on top. Corn tortillas were good with this recipe, but I would like some kind of sauce to drizzle on top as well, and i think next time i will end up shredding the chicken.

We ended up with cilantro instead of oregano and I'm guessing it is even better that way. Also, I used the pan that we cooked in to warm my shells. I have to be gluten free and the corn ones tend to fall apart but these held together great and had extra kick of flavor. Great and quick recipe!!
I used Truvia instead of sugar. Great, easy recipe. I may add more lime juice next time.
I doubled everything except for the chicken.

Neither my husband or myself cared for this recipe. What resulted from this recipe isn't anything close to any taco I've ever eaten. I used corn instead of flour tortillas. I didn't add the oregano because I don't care for it. I tried adding cilantro on my taco and even that was no help.

we loved them! absolutely wonderful, light not heavy like beef tacos. I didn't put the oregano in though, and I put serachi sauce in them because I like a little kick in mine. We had cantelope for desert. 
oh yeah, i put more than just lettuce, i shredded some carrots and minced up a few veggies. next time i will try some black beans and corn.
I Did add avocado slices as a garnish.

I loved making these for me and my family it's a light and healthy meal and the only thing I added was a little bit of chipotle seasoning and cilantro. The cilantro was definitely key in amped up the lime flavor
I have made this several times, never any leftovers. Great flavor. I always replace cilantro for the oregano. I also cut back the cooking time by about 10 minutes.

I've been meaning to try these because the picture looks delicious and I was quite disappointed. I followed the recipe exactly as written. The sauce is skimpy but the red wine vinegar adds some nice flavor. May try swapping cilantro for the oregano and adding more lime juice. Overall not a bad recipe.
This turned out amazing. Only thing that we added was extra lime juice and we had spicy guacamole to go with it. Kids love it too
Wayyyy too spicy for me. May try it again with just a dash of pepper!
So easy and delicious. I will be making this again and again.

Tried this recipe after a recommendation from a friend. My 3 young children plus my husband and I loved it! It's fresh and has a "zing" because of the lime and vinegar, but isn't spicy. I typically quadruple the seasonings (everything but the chicken) to give it max flavor and cooking liquid.
I made this exactly as stated and it was delicious. I usually do not like chicken tacos so this is a huge bonus.
Amazing flavor and super simple!! Thanks for sharing.

I'm not one to leave reviews but couldn't pass on this one! Like LadyJayPee, I substituted Cilantro for the Oregano which was perfect. I tripled the sauce & marinated chicken in 2/3 of it for a couple hours. In the skillet, the sauce thickens/caramelizes which makes the flavor REALLY come out! I removed the chicken, leaving the scrapings from the sauce in pan, added a little olive oil & some remaining sauce with sliced sweet onion and red & yellow peppers and sauteed until slightly browned. Added the chicken back to skillet with peppers and warmed it all together then served on warm flour tortillas with sour cream. Eating it all like this, it did not need salsa or really anything else! The red wine vinegar, sugar and cilantro give it the best flavor. Another reviewer thought it had some kick, but I didn't really think it did. The kick, if any, is from the vinegar so lighten up on that a little if you'd like. Definitely will make again, thanks for sharing!

Chicken tastes amazing. 
Some of the reviewers have commented about 'kick'. Well that's a personal choice. If you want a kick just add to salsa. Before deciding on a recipe, try once just as it is. It's a great recipe with flavours in it. 
Next time I will try BBQ with same ingredients. I think it can be used for sandwiches too. Thank you for sharing ??

YUM! Great flavor! DISCLAIMER: I don't review recipes unless I follow them closely, with only minor alterations (using jarred garlic vs. fresh, for example). As an Allrecipes user, I get so frustrated with "It was great! (or awful)... I changed XYZ to ABC"-- you read the review and it's not even close to the same recipe. That being said: REVIEW: I made this for my daughter's volleyball team potluck of 35 people. It is refreshingly different from standard shredded chicken recipes (so tired of 'salsa chicken'). I made 7.5 lbs of chicken and used Allrecipes 'servings adjuster'. I used bottled lime juice instead of fresh, Mexican oregano instead of regular, jarred minced garlic instead of cloves. I cooked it in a Ninja cooking system on medium stovetop, then flipped it to low slow cooker until I had time to shred it. I didn't think there was going to be enough liquid, but after it was cooked & shredded, the liquid was perfect--not dry or sloppy. A nice alternative to standard "cumin/green chili/salsa" chicken recipes. If you are looking for a strong, spicy, "taco" flavored recipe, this isn't for you. It's delicate and fresh with great blends of flavor, it's healthy and low sodium (no packages!), assuming you have it on a salad instead of a tortilla. We added toppings (hot sauce, cilantro, etc.) and served per our personal preference. This has been requested by my teens to have on hand for lunches and after school.

This is a great base to start with. I made a marinade using the ingredients up to the garnishments by increasing the stated amounts by 4 and then placing the cubed chicken in the marinade for 1 hour. I then poured the entire contents in a sauce pan and sauteed until the chicken was thoroughly cooked. Instead of red salsa I made a mango avocado salsa to replace the red salsa and used mild cheddar cheese. The taste was unbelievable?
easy and tastes great! My family loved it!

I've made this several times now and it has become a new family favorite. So easy to make and so delicious! 

The first time I made it exactly according to recipe. Since then, I have omitted the green onion and have added some chopped regular onion in with the chicken instead. (It is equally good and I rarely have green onions on hand, but I usually have regular onion.) 

I think the cooking times in the recipe are a little long. I just cook till the chicken and onions are almost done, add the sauce ingredients, then cook a little longer till the sauce starts to thicken.

This was way better than I expected. Ingredients sounded odd but it was really good! Like a few others, I cooked it in the slow cooker. I'm lazy that way, lol. Whisked all the ingredients in the ungreased (yes ungreased!) crockpot (oh I didn't have green onion so I used about 1/4 cup diced brown onion), added the cubed chicken, mixed to coat the meat, then cooked it on low (untouched) for about 3 1/2 hours. I was tempted to add more liquid since it looked dry but not necessary as the chicken juiced up nicely. And, I actually liked the oregano, but maybe it's because I used Mexican oregano? Served with flour tortillas, lettuce, tomato, jack cheese, sour cream and tomatillo salsa. It's a keeper, will make again. Thank you Marissa!
Love this recipe!
Very easy, and my entire family enjoyed it. I had fresh cilantro on hand, so substituted that for dried oregano.
This was a nice switch up from ground beef tacos, shredded chicken, or fajitas.

WOW the flavors! This was so simple to make, but the flavors were so intense. I used premade chicken I had shredded and followed the rest of the recipe exact. I had everything on hand and we will be making it again. Nothing bland about this recipe. Thanks!
My wife and I enjoyed it. I tweaked it a little and gave it juice from an entire lime (because I love lime) and tossed in a tsp of chili powder.
I added a vegetarian beef filling crumble instead of the chicken and added diced jalepeno and taco seasoning to the mix. Overall a very good taco that I'll make for my family many times!
Next time I'd use more lime juice...the lime flavor got lost somewhat.
